fields.helpText: This is 9 numbers, sometimes with 'GB' at the start, for example 123456789 or GB123456789. You can find it on your VAT registration certificate

sections.description: You can find these on the certificate of incorporation you received when you registered your business as a limited company with Companies House.

fields.label: Company registration number
fields.helpText: This is 8 numbers, or 2 letters followed by 6 numbers. For example, 01234567 or SC123456

sections.title: Business contact details
sections.description: Enter the contact details for the main place of business, where the day-to-day business activities are managed.

fields.label: Are these the contact details you want HMRC to use if we need to discuss your Aggregates Levy information?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you want HMRC to use these as your preferred contact details

sections.title: Preferred contact details
sections.description: Provide the contact details of someone who is authorised to discuss your Aggregates Levy information with HMRC.

fields.label: Full name
fields.helpText: Enter the full name of the contact person

sections.title: How many UK aggregates sites do you operate?

fields.helpText: You must tell us about all the sites you operate or plan to operate
fields.errorMessage: You must enter a number between 1 and 100, if you have more than 100 sites refer to the guidance for this service on GOV.UK

sections.title: Details for aggregates site $n
sections.description: Enter the details for your aggregates site.

fields.label: Site grid reference
fields.helpText: Enter the Ordnance Survey grid reference of the entrance to the site. For example, TQ 336805

fields.label: Do you use a weighbridge to weigh aggregates at this site?
fields.errorMessage: You must select whether you use a weighbridge
optionHelpText: You will need to contact HMRC to agree an alternative method for weighing aggregates. Contact details will be provided after completing this registration.

fields.infoText: You only need to provide the following details if you have recently taken over this site from another operator.

fields.label: Business name of previous site operator
Aggregates levy registration number of previous site operator

sections.title: What percentage of your business's total sales are from importing aggregates?
sections.description: Enter your estimated percentage of total sales from importing aggregates.

fields.shortName: Percentage of total sales from importing aggregates
fields.helpText: Enter 0 if your business is not involved in this activity

sections.title: What percentage of your business's total sales are from aggregates extraction activities?
sections.description: Enter your business's current or estimated percentage of total sales from each activity listed below.

fields.infoText: Enter 0 if your business is not involved in an activity.

fields.shortName: Percentage of total sales from activity

sections.title: What date did your business first commercially exploit aggregates?

fields.shortName: Date busines first commercially exploited aggregates
fields.helpText: Enter the date your business first commercially exploited aggregates or formed the intention to. For example 21 4 2018

fields.label: What is commercially exploiting aggregates?
fields.infoText:
Aggregate is considered as being commercially exploited when it is exploited for the benefit of business. For example when it is:

* removed from its originating site or a connected site that is registered under the same name 


* subject to an agreement to supply (such as a contract)


* used for construction purposes 


* mixed with anything other than water, except in permitted circumstances 

You become liable to register for Aggregates  Levy when you first commercially exploit aggregates or form the intention to.

Full details are given in Excise Notice AGL1.

sections.title: Estimate how much Aggregates Levy you'll pay in the next 12 months

fields.shortName: Estimate of Aggregates Levy payment for next 12 months
fields.helpText: Multiply the number of tonnes of aggregates you think you'll commercially exploit by the rate of Aggregates Levy

fields.label: Where can I find out the current rate of levy?
fields.infoText: The current rate for Aggregates Levy can be found in section 1.7 of Excise Notice AGL1.

sections.title: Do you expect any of your commercial activity to be exempt or relieved from the levy?
sections.shortName: Activities exempt or relieved from the levy

fields.shortName: Do you expect any of your commercial activitity be exempt or relieved from the levy

fields.label: What is exempt from the levy or eligible for relief?
fields.infoText:
The following are examples of what is exempt from Aggregates Levy:

* coal, lignite, clay, slate, soil or vegetable or other organic matter

* blocks of stone (dimension stone) and limestone for the production of lime or cement

* certain industrial minerals (such as metal ores, gypsum, fluorspar)

* waste that's wholly from industrial combustion processes or the smelting or refining of metals

* drill cuttings (in permitted circumstances) and waste from certain processes such as highways or railways excavation, navigational dredging and building construction (in permitted circumstances)

The following are examples of what is relieved from Aggregates Levy: 

* any aggregate used in certain industrial or agricultural processes (such as glass manufacture, fertiliser production)

* aggregate that has previously carried levy and to which an exempt process is applied

Relief can also be obtained on aggregates that are exported to a destination outside of the UK.

Full details of the exemptions and reliefs are given in Excise Notices AGL1 and AGL2.

sections.title: Estimate the amount of exempt, relieved or exported supplies you expect to make in the next 12 months
sections.shortName: Estimate of exempt, relieved or exported supplies for next 12 months

fields.infoText: Enter 0 for any option that does not apply to your business.

sections.title: Enter the bank details for your business
sections.description: You need to provide these details as HMRC may, in some circumstances, need to make a repayment to you.

fields.label: Sort code

declarationSection.title: Confirm details and send your registration

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm we have received your registration

fields.label: Select the status relevant to you
fields.helpText: For limited companies, a director or company secretary must complete this declaration

fields.infoText: By entering your full name above you confirm that the information you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.

You must check the guidance for this service on GOV.UK to see whether you need to fill in and send any additional forms to complete your registration (for example if your business is a partnership you must also fill in and send form AL2) if you haven't already done so.

HMRC will send you a letter to confirm your registration details and return dates so that you can prepare your first Aggregates Levy return. 

Returns will normally cover a 3 month period but if you would like to apply for non-standard periods, such as monthly returns, or periods that match your VAT return periods, you can contact the HMRC Excise team on enquiries.eeitts@hmrc.gsi.gov.uk

If you do not use a weighbridge you will also need to get in touch with the Excise team to agree an alternative method for weighing your aggregates.
